title: I don't even know where to start....(rubber banding, invisible jungle camps, massive fps drops, etc)
body:
Pardon me, but because of the frustration what must certainly and is most LIKELY to be a completely mixed bag of not only updating to macOS Sierra (10.12) as well as what many others seem to be experiencing since patch 6.20, in addition to what may be done on my end, as well, but I figured I could at least try something I saw in the FPS issues guide and stumbled upon this piece of advice.

Disabling Automatic graphics switching:

Open System Preferences
Click Energy Saver
Uncheck the Automatic graphics switching option at the top of the Energy Saver dialog
Click the Lock icon at the bottom left of the dialog to prevent further changes
Reboot your system

Here's the thing, though: there is no such option within my Energy Saver. Is it hidden elsewhere depnding on what kind of Mac one has or is it only certain ones have, at all?

iMac (21.5-inch, Mid 2011)

Processor: 2.7 GHz Intel Core i5
Memory: 4 GB 1333 MHz DDR3
Graphics: AMD Radeon HD 6770M 512 MB

Since I'm here anyway, is there anything else I should be aware of that may or may not be accurate for my system for trying to navigate my way through? I'm not very troubleshoot-savvy ever since I switched to my iMac  5 years ago.

replies.body:
There definitely seem to be a few different things going on. I suggest we first focus on your rubber-banding and invisible jungle camps, as I suspect they're a result of a poor connection to the servers. I recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to ensure your local network settings are up to par.

Let me know if anything changed as a result of those steps.
